query: Picard-Fuchs period integrals Calabi-Yau GKZ hypergeometric system KKLT Large Volume Scenario moduli stabilization IIB flux compactification special geometry Kahler potential de Sitter uplift swampland conjecture Yukawa couplings mirror symmetry Gukov-Vafa-Witten superpotential tadpole

concepts.label: SYZ mirror symmetry
concepts.description: Strominger-Yau-Zaslow mirror construction via special Lagrangian fibrations, providing a geometric dual description of two mirror Calabi-Yau manifolds.

concepts.label: toric Calabi-Yau varieties
concepts.description: Calabi-Yau 3-folds with torus action and fan description, compactifications of C^3 defined by toric polytopes with h^{1,1} and h^{2,1} determined by polytope combinatorics.

concepts.label: period integrals
concepts.description: Holomorphic integrals Π_a(z) = ∫_{γ_a} Ω(z) of the (3,0)-form on CY3 over homology cycles, encoding dependence on complex-structure moduli.

concepts.label: Picard-Fuchs system
concepts.description: GKZ differential equations L_i Π = 0 satisfied by period integrals, derived from the toric ambient space lattice and GLSM charge matrix.

concepts.label: complex-structure moduli
concepts.description: Parameters z = (z_1,...,z_{h^{2,1}}) that characterize deformations of the complex structure of a Calabi-Yau manifold.

concepts.label: flux superpotential
concepts.description: Effective superpotential W = ∫(G_3 ∧ Ω) = G_a Π^a + F_a determined by three-form flux G_3 integrated against the holomorphic form via periods.

concepts.label: Kähler potential
concepts.description: Function K = -ln(-i∫(Ω∧Ω̄)) - 2ln(V) governing supersymmetric effective dynamics; sum of geometric and volume contributions.

concepts.label: Kähler moduli
concepts.description: Parameters τ^a controlling the sizes and shapes of divisors in the Kähler cone; related to periods via the mirror map t^a = ∂F/∂X^a.

concepts.label: moduli stabilization
concepts.description: Mechanism for fixing the moduli (complex-structure and Kähler) to discrete values via flux superpotential and non-perturbative corrections.

concepts.label: KKLT construction
concepts.description: Kachru-Kallosh-Linde-Trivedi scenario for de Sitter vacua: flux-stabilize complex structure with W_0 << 1, then uplift via non-perturbative gaugino condensation or D3-instantons.

concepts.label: Large Volume Scenario
concepts.description: Moduli stabilization regime requiring h^{1,1} ≥ 2 and exponentially large volumes V ~ e^{aτ_s}; stabilizes via α'-corrections and non-perturbative effects.

concepts.label: special Lagrangian fibration
concepts.description: A fibration of a Calabi-Yau by special Lagrangian cycles (calibrated submanifolds) with respect to the SYZ construction; provides the geometric mirror mechanism.

concepts.label: mirror map
concepts.description: Isomorphism between the Kähler moduli space of one CY and complex-structure moduli of its mirror, given by t^a = ∂F/∂X^a where F is the prepotential.

concepts.label: Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: Cubic interaction term κ_{abc} = F_{abc} in the effective superpotential; at large volume determined by intersection numbers of divisors.

concepts.label: D6 orbifold symmetry
concepts.description: Dihedral symmetry of order 12 acting on a toric CY polytope; reduces h^{2,1}=20 complex-structure moduli to 5 D6-invariant degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau hypersurface
concepts.description: A three-dimensional Kähler manifold with vanishing first Chern class, defined as a hypersurface in a toric ambient space.

concepts.label: toric geometry
concepts.description: Algebraic geometry framework using lattice polytopes and their fans to study varieties with torus actions, providing systematic access to Gröbner bases and GKZ systems.

concepts.label: mirror symmetry
concepts.description: Duality between pairs of Calabi-Yau manifolds exchanging complex-structure and Kähler moduli, relating period integrals to quantum geometry.

concepts.label: Gröbner basis
concepts.description: A special set of generators of the toric ideal that determines the structure of local solutions and differential operators in the GKZ system.

concepts.label: large radius limit
concepts.description: Special limiting region of moduli space where the Calabi-Yau volume becomes large and classical geometry dominates; geometric interpretation becomes transparent.

concepts.label: intersection ring
concepts.description: The cohomology ring of a toric variety equipped with the cup product, encoding intersection numbers of divisors and curves.

concepts.label: Hodge numbers
concepts.description: Topological invariants h^{p,q} characterising the cohomology of the Calabi-Yau; h^{2,1} equals the complex-structure moduli dimension.

concepts.label: Fermat hypersurface
concepts.description: A special class of toric hypersurface defined by monomials of equal degree, admitting explicit algebraic and period integral analysis.

concepts.label: Landau-Ginzburg model
concepts.description: A superpotential-based model whose critical locus defines a singular variety; non-LG models studied here relate to non-geometric phases.

concepts.label: differential operators
concepts.description: Linear differential operators constructed from the GKZ system acting on period integrals; their principal parts encode intersection theory.

concepts.label: local solutions
concepts.description: Analytic solutions to the GKZ differential system valid in a neighbourhood of special points (e.g., large radius limit or conifold locus).

concepts.label: toric ideal
concepts.description: The ideal in a polynomial ring generated by binomials, whose structure determines the GKZ differential equations via the GLSM charge matrix.

concepts.label: Schoen Calabi-Yau threefold
concepts.description: A self-mirror Calabi-Yau threefold with h¹¹=12, h²¹=12 and D₆ symmetry used as a compactification geometry for type IIB string theory.

concepts.label: Non-perturbative corrections
concepts.description: Exponentially suppressed terms W_np ~ e^{-aτ} in the superpotential from D3-instantons or gaugino condensation on wrapped branes.

concepts.label: Effective scalar potential
concepts.description: The four-dimensional effective potential V_eff derived from the superpotential and Kähler potential; determines the vacuum structure and moduli stabilization.

concepts.label: F-term uplift
concepts.description: Mechanism for lifting vacua to positive cosmological constant by adding F-term contributions from anti-D3 branes or F-term corrections in LVS.

concepts.label: de Sitter vacuum
concepts.description: Four-dimensional vacuum with positive cosmological constant Λ > 0; obtained via moduli stabilization and SUSY-breaking uplifts in string theory.

concepts.label: Swampland conjecture
concepts.description: Conjectural consistency criterion from quantum gravity: in any effective field theory, |∇V| ≥ c·V for some c > 0; rules out certain SUSY-breaking vacua.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau manifold
concepts.description: A complex Kähler manifold with vanishing first Chern class c₁(X)=0, admitting a unique Ricci-flat metric and a nowhere-vanishing holomorphic (n,0)-form Ω.

concepts.label: special Lagrangian submanifold
concepts.description: A calibrated Lagrangian submanifold L in a Calabi-Yau manifold defined by Im(e^{iθ} Ω|_L) = 0 for some fixed phase θ ∈ [0, 2π).

concepts.label: holonomy group
concepts.description: The Lie group of parallel transports around loops in the tangent bundle; Calabi-Yau m-folds are characterized by holonomy ⊆ SU(m).

concepts.label: Kähler geometry
concepts.description: Differential geometry of complex manifolds equipped with a Kähler metric ω = ∂∂̄K, combining symplectic and complex structure.

concepts.label: Calabi Conjecture
concepts.description: Theorem (Yau, 1978): any Kähler manifold with c₁=0 admits a unique Ricci-flat Kähler metric in each Kähler class.

concepts.label: calibrated geometry
concepts.description: Framework defining calibrated submanifolds via a closed p-form calibration φ such that φ|_L = vol_L for minimal submanifolds L.

concepts.label: deformation theory
concepts.description: Study of infinitesimal and global deformations of geometric structures, controlling how submanifolds vary in moduli spaces.

concepts.label: moduli space
concepts.description: Parameter space classifying geometric structures (e.g., compact special Lagrangian submanifolds) up to isomorphism; typically a finite-dimensional manifold or orbifold.

concepts.label: singularities of special Lagrangian submanifolds
concepts.description: Isolated and non-isolated singular points of special Lagrangian cycles, locally modelled on cones or higher-codimension singular sets.

concepts.label: SYZ Conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture (Strominger-Yau-Zaslow) that mirror Calabi-Yau pairs admit dual special Lagrangian fibrations with torus fibres, explaining mirror symmetry geometrically.

concepts.label: holomorphic (n,0)-form
concepts.description: A nowhere-vanishing holomorphic differential form Ω of degree (n,0) on a Calabi-Yau n-fold; defines the volume form via Ω ∧ Ω̄ = (i^n/2^n) vol.

concepts.label: Ricci-flat metric
concepts.description: A Kähler metric with vanishing Ricci tensor Ric = 0, induced on Calabi-Yau manifolds by the Calabi Conjecture.

concepts.label: almost Calabi-Yau manifold
concepts.description: A generalization of Calabi-Yau manifolds (not necessarily Kähler) admitting a nowhere-vanishing holomorphic (n,0)-form and calibrated geometry; useful for special Lagrangian deformation theory.

concepts.label: thermal effective potential
concepts.description: One-loop potential arising from finite-temperature string compactifications via free action on the Euclidean time circle; lifts moduli dynamically.

concepts.label: conifold locus
concepts.description: Singular subspace in moduli space where the Calabi-Yau develops a node; responsible for enhanced gauge symmetry and light BPS states.

concepts.label: gauge theory
concepts.description: Quantum field theory with local gauge symmetry geometrically engineered near singular loci of the Calabi-Yau compactification.

concepts.label: BPS states
concepts.description: Massive states preserving a fraction of supersymmetry that become massless at singular loci, affecting the effective dynamics.

concepts.label: hypermultiplet moduli
concepts.description: Scalar fields transforming in hypermultiplet representations of N=2 supersymmetry, arising from matter coupled to gauge theories.

concepts.label: vector multiplet moduli
concepts.description: Scalar fields in vector multiplet representations of N=2 supersymmetry, parametrizing the Coulomb branch of gauge theories.

concepts.label: type IIA compactification
concepts.description: String theory with two-form RR field and odd-dimensional D-branes, compactified on a Calabi-Yau threefold.

concepts.label: heterotic duality
concepts.description: Duality relating type IIA on Calabi-Yau to heterotic string on K3 × T², exchanging complex and Kähler structure.

concepts.label: axio-dilaton
concepts.description: Modulus field τ = χ + i/g_s combining the axion and dilaton in heterotic string; dual to Kähler moduli in type IIA.

concepts.label: self-mirror Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: Calabi-Yau threefold satisfying mirror symmetry self-duality, simplifying period integral structure and α'-corrections.

concepts.label: α'-corrections
concepts.description: Perturbative quantum gravity corrections to the effective potential, suppressed in large-volume and self-mirror constructions.

concepts.label: de Sitter vacua
concepts.description: Metastable vacuum states with small positive cosmological constant Λ > 0, corresponding to exponentially suppressed uplifting contributions.

concepts.label: swampland conjectures
concepts.description: Conjectures constraining effective potentials realizable in consistent string theory, particularly de Sitter conjecture |∇V| ≥ c·V.

concepts.label: Type IIB orientifold
concepts.description: String theory compactification on a CY3 with O-plane orientifold projection, enabling both complex-structure and Kähler moduli stabilization via fluxes and non-perturbative effects.

concepts.label: K3-fibred structure
concepts.description: A CY3 that fibres over ℙ¹ with K3 surfaces as generic fibres, enabling systematic volume-form decomposition and moduli stabilization.

concepts.label: Gaugino condensation
concepts.description: Non-perturbative effect in which condensation of gaugino bilinears on wrapped D-branes generates exponentially-suppressed contributions to the superpotential.

concepts.label: Poly-instanton corrections
concepts.description: Higher-order non-perturbative corrections from multiple instantons; contribute additional terms to the superpotential beyond single-instanton effects.

concepts.label: α′-corrections
concepts.description: String-loop and worldsheet-instanton corrections to the Kähler potential, suppressed by powers of α′ = l_s²/M_p²; crucial for stabilizing large Kähler moduli.

concepts.label: Del Pezzo surface
concepts.description: A Fano surface that is a blowup of ℙ² at generic points; appears as a divisor in CY3 geometries and plays a key role in volume form structure.

concepts.label: W-surface
concepts.description: A genus-1 fibred surface appearing as a divisor in K3-fibred CY3 geometries; contributes to the decomposition of the Kähler cone.

concepts.label: Reflexive polytope
concepts.description: A lattice polytope P such that both P and its polar dual P° are lattice polytopes; classifies toric Fano varieties and generates CY3 via GLSM construction.

concepts.label: Abelian integrals
concepts.description: Integrals of algebraic differential forms over cycles of an algebraic variety, generalizing elliptic integrals and period integrals on CY manifolds.

concepts.label: relative cohomology
concepts.description: Cohomology group H^n(X,X_∞) measuring differential forms modulo those with poles, dual to the module of Abelian integrals.

concepts.label: GKZ operator
concepts.description: Differential operator L_i constructed from the charge matrix of a toric ambient space, generating the Picard-Fuchs ideal annihilating period integrals.

concepts.label: polynomial at infinity
concepts.description: A regular polynomial f(x,y) in two variables whose behavior at infinity is controlled, used to define the corresponding Abelian integral module.

concepts.label: module isomorphism
concepts.description: Canonical isomorphism between the module of relative cohomologies H^*(X,X_∞) and the module of Abelian integrals, proven via integral representation.

concepts.label: algebraic variety
concepts.description: Geometric object defined by polynomial equations, including CY manifolds and their total spaces, on which period integrals are naturally defined.

concepts.label: differential form
concepts.description: Exterior form with smooth or meromorphic coefficients on an algebraic variety; the space of forms closed modulo exact forms constitutes cohomology.

concepts.label: cycle
concepts.description: A formal sum of oriented submanifolds (homology class) over which period integrals are integrated; dual to the relative cohomology.

concepts.label: de Sitter saddle point
concepts.description: Critical point of the effective scalar potential with positive cosmological constant (dS4 geometry); metastable or unstable equilibrium.

concepts.label: flux quantization
concepts.description: Requirement that three-form fluxes G_3 and RR/NS fluxes satisfy Dirac quantization conditions; constrains allowed flux choices.

concepts.label: large internal volume
concepts.description: Regime where the CY3 volume V >> 1 (in string units); suppresses α' corrections and ensures weak coupling.

concepts.label: weak coupling
concepts.description: Regime where string coupling g_s << 1; ensures validity of perturbative type IIB string theory.

concepts.label: Weak Gravity Conjecture
concepts.description: Swampland conjecture requiring existence of light charged particles; constrains the tower of instanton corrections in string compactifications.

concepts.label: type IIB string compactification
concepts.description: Compactification of type IIB supergravity on a CY3 manifold to four dimensions with fluxes and branes; provides effective N=1 supergravity.

concepts.label: uplifting term
concepts.description: Explicit positive-energy contribution (anti-D3 brane, D-term, or F-term) added to the potential to achieve de Sitter vacua; contrasted with uplifting-free constructions.

concepts.label: integral variations of Hodge structure
concepts.description: Families of integral (3,0)-forms on CY3 parametrized by moduli, satisfying Picard-Fuchs equations; the periods encode both geometry and physics of string compactifications.

concepts.label: special geometry
concepts.description: Hodge-theoretic structure on complex-structure and Kähler moduli spaces of CY; relates Kähler metric K_{ij̄} = ∂_i ∂_{j̄} K and Yukawa couplings to period integrals.

concepts.label: one-parameter families
concepts.description: Subfamily of CY threefolds depending on a single complex parameter z; topologically realized as fibrations over the thrice-punctured sphere ℙ¹ \ {0,1,∞}.

concepts.label: thrice-punctured sphere
concepts.description: The Riemann sphere ℙ¹ with three punctures (typically at z = 0, 1, ∞); serves as the base for one-parameter families of CY with monodromy singularities.

concepts.label: geometric realization
concepts.description: Problem of determining which abstract integral variations of Hodge structure actually arise as period domains of families of Calabi-Yau threefolds, rather than purely algebraically.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau compactification
concepts.description: String theory compactification on a Calabi-Yau 3-fold (CY3) to obtain 4D effective field theory with moduli fields.

concepts.label: tadpole conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture that the number of stabilised complex-structure moduli grows at most linearly with flux tadpole charge N_flux, bounded by 2/3 h_{2,1}.

concepts.label: flux tadpole
concepts.description: Measure of total quantised G_3 flux charge coupling to complex-structure moduli stabilisation.

concepts.label: Gepner model
concepts.description: Non-geometric conformal field theory model on the worldsheet, mirror dual to a rigid Calabi-Yau in the interior of moduli space.

concepts.label: non-geometric background
concepts.description: String compactification background without a geometric large-radius description, such as Gepner models or orbifolold limits.

concepts.label: rigid Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: Calabi-Yau manifold with h^{2,1} = 0, possessing no complex-structure deformations.

concepts.label: supersymmetric Minkowski solution
concepts.description: 4D vacuum with vanishing cosmological constant and unbroken supersymmetry, characterised by dW/dz_i = 0.

concepts.label: massless moduli conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture that in supergravity, Minkowski vacua require at least some massless moduli; refuted in non-geometric backgrounds.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau operator
concepts.description: A Fuchsian differential operator that determines ℚ-local systems underlying a variation of Hodge structure with h^{3,0}=h^{2,1}=h^{1,2}=h^{0,3}=1, appearing as Picard-Fuchs operators for families of CY3 threefolds.

concepts.label: Fuchsian differential system
concepts.description: A system of linear differential equations with regular singularities, satisfying L_i Π = 0 where L_i are differential operators with poles of order ≤1.

concepts.label: variation of Hodge structure
concepts.description: A parametrized family of Hodge decompositions H^n = ⊕_{p+q=n} H^{p,q} varying holomorphically over a moduli space, with period vectors satisfying Picard-Fuchs equations.

concepts.label: ℚ-local system
concepts.description: A locally constant sheaf of ℚ-vector spaces over the moduli space, with monodromy determined by the Picard-Fuchs system around singular loci.

concepts.label: rational curves
concepts.description: Genus-zero algebraic curves on a variety; their enumerative invariants (Gromov-Witten invariants) are encoded in period integrals of the mirror.

concepts.label: one-parameter family
concepts.description: A family of CY threefolds depending on a single complex modulus, yielding a scalar Picard-Fuchs operator of ordinary differential equations.

concepts.label: Griffiths transversality
concepts.description: Condition governing how the Hodge filtration of the cohomology varies with moduli, ensuring periods satisfy integrability constraints related to special geometry.

concepts.label: Feynman integrals
concepts.description: Loop integrals in quantum field theory whose evaluation can be connected to Calabi-Yau period integrals via differential equations and iterated integrals.

concepts.label: Frobenius structure
concepts.description: Graded algebra structure on the cohomology of a Calabi-Yau manifold characterizing the monodromy action and permitting decomposition of the period matrix.

concepts.label: Non-geometric fluxes
concepts.description: Q-flux and R-flux components arising in string theory backgrounds with non-geometric structure; contributions to the flux superpotential.

concepts.label: Tadpole cancellation
concepts.description: Constraint on flux quanta from D-brane charge conservation: N_flux + flux contributions = 2/3 h_{2,1} (tadpole conjecture).

concepts.label: Geometric fluxes
concepts.description: H-flux and F-flux components arising from NS-NS and RR three-form fields in string compactifications.

concepts.label: Brown-Teitelboum brane nucleation
concepts.description: Instanton process mediating transitions between vacua via nucleation of D5/NS5 branes, changing the flux quantum number.

concepts.label: Coleman-de Luccia tunneling
concepts.description: Semiclassical tunneling mechanism through the effective potential barrier connecting two vacua, computed via the Euclidean action.

concepts.label: Anti-D3 brane uplift
concepts.description: Mechanism to lift AdS minima to metastable dS via non-perturbative potential from anti-D3 branes at the Klebanov-Strassler throat.

concepts.label: Decay rate
concepts.description: Exponential transition probability per unit time, Γ ~ exp(-S_E) where S_E is the Euclidean action of the instanton.

concepts.label: Effective field theory description
concepts.description: Low-energy supergravity approximation valid when mass scales of heavy moduli are well-separated from the cosmological scale.

concepts.label: crystalline cohomology
concepts.description: A p-adic cohomology theory for varieties over fields of characteristic p>0, serving as an analogue of de Rham cohomology in positive characteristic.

concepts.label: prepotential
concepts.description: A homogeneous function F(X^a) that encodes Yukawa couplings and determines the Kähler potential via special geometry relations.

concepts.label: maximal unipotent monodromy
concepts.description: A singularity structure at a boundary point of the moduli space where the local monodromy matrix is unipotent with maximal Jordan block; associated with large complex-structure or conifold limits.

concepts.label: canonical coordinates
concepts.description: Special coordinates on moduli space (often periods or their derivatives) that exhibit integral or integrality-respecting properties under mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: integrality property
concepts.description: A property requiring that certain geometric invariants (periods, Yukawa couplings, or their derivatives) are integers or rational multiples of each other under appropriate normalization.

concepts.label: ordinary variety
concepts.description: A smooth projective variety in characteristic p > 0 whose Frobenius endomorphism acts with maximal rank on crystalline cohomology, generalizing ordinary elliptic curves.

concepts.label: moduli space boundary
concepts.description: The boundary locus of the moduli space of complex structures, characterized by singularities or degenerate period matrices.

concepts.label: p-adic analogue
concepts.description: A geometric or arithmetic property defined over p-adic fields or in characteristic p that mirrors a classical (complex) geometric property.

concepts.label: B-brane superpotential
concepts.description: Holomorphic function depending on open and closed moduli encoding the effective interaction energy of B-type branes wrapping cycles in a Calabi-Yau manifold.

concepts.label: blow-up
concepts.description: Resolution of singularities in a variety by replacing a subvariety (curve) with its exceptional divisor, producing a smooth ambient space.

concepts.label: A-model
concepts.description: Topological string theory quantized on Kähler geometry; computes genus-g Gromov-Witten invariants and open-string Ooguri-Vafa invariants.

concepts.label: Ooguri-Vafa invariant
concepts.description: Integer invariant counting open-string worldsheet instantons ending on a Lagrangian brane in a Calabi-Yau; extracted from open-string amplitudes in the A-model.

concepts.label: closed modulus
concepts.description: Parameter controlling the complex-structure or Kähler geometry of the ambient Calabi-Yau manifold, not coupled to open-string boundary conditions.

concepts.label: open modulus
concepts.description: Parameter characterizing the position, deformation, or Wilson line of a D-brane or B-brane in the Calabi-Yau; coupled to open-string boundary conditions.

concepts.label: complete intersection
concepts.description: A variety defined as the transverse intersection of hypersurfaces in a toric ambient space, generalizing hypersurface singularities.

concepts.label: complex-structure modulus
concepts.description: A parameter z_i controlling the shape and algebraic equations defining a Calabi-Yau manifold while preserving the holomorphic (3,0)-form.

concepts.label: D7-brane matter fields
concepts.description: Chiral matter fermions and scalars arising from open strings on wrapped D7 branes; their Kähler metrics depend on both complex and Kähler moduli.

concepts.label: modular weight
concepts.description: Scaling exponent under Kähler moduli rescaling that determines the Kähler potential dependence of matter field kinetic terms and Yukawa couplings.

concepts.label: soft supersymmetry breaking
concepts.description: Soft terms in effective field theory (gaugino masses, squark masses, A-terms) arising from supergravity F-term breaking; their form is controlled by the Kähler potential.

concepts.label: toroidal compactification
concepts.description: String compactification on a product of tori T^6; simplest case where Kähler potential is exactly computable, used for benchmarking.

concepts.label: matter metric
concepts.description: Metric K_{I J̄} on the space of matter field scalar components; controls kinetic terms and is determined by the Kähler potential via K_{I J̄} = ∂_I ∂_{J̄} K.

concepts.label: perturbative expansion
concepts.description: Systematic expansion of physical quantities (Kähler potential, matter metrics) in powers of αʹ or powers of moduli field values; valid at weak coupling or large volume.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau landscape
concepts.description: The ensemble of Calabi-Yau threefold geometries arising in type IIB string compactifications, parameterised by moduli and exhibiting varying physical properties.

concepts.label: Kähler moduli inflation
concepts.description: Inflationary mechanism in type IIB compactifications where the volume modulus or fibre moduli serve as the inflaton field, with slow-roll conditions translating to geometric constraints.

concepts.label: slow-roll condition
concepts.description: Inflationary requirement that the scalar potential gradient is small compared to the potential itself, ensuring quasi-exponential expansion: ε ≪ 1, η ≪ 1.

concepts.label: type IIB compactification
concepts.description: String theory compactification on a Calabi-Yau threefold with O3/O7-plane orientifold projection, yielding four-dimensional N=1 supergravity with complex and Kähler moduli.

concepts.label: O3/O7-plane orientifold
concepts.description: Orientifold projection of type IIB string theory introducing O-plane fixed loci and corresponding tadpole constraints that constrain the flux and brane content.

concepts.label: moduli space dimension
concepts.description: The total number of independent moduli fields parameterising the moduli space, equal to h^{1,1} + h^{2,1} for CY threefolds in type IIB.

concepts.label: inflationary constraint
concepts.description: Geometric constraint on the Kähler moduli space arising from slow-roll requirements, restricting the Kähler metric and curvature to allow sufficient field excursion and small acceleration.

concepts.label: volume modulus
concepts.description: The Kähler modulus τ_b associated with the overall volume of the Calabi-Yau, appearing logarithmically in the Kähler potential and controlling the string coupling.

concepts.label: log Calabi-Yau compactification
concepts.description: A compactification of a Landau-Ginzburg model that extends a weak LG model to a log Calabi-Yau variety, relating Fano geometry to mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Fano variety
concepts.description: A smooth projective variety whose anticanonical divisor is ample, serving as the geometric base for Landau-Ginzburg mirrors.

concepts.label: singular compactification
concepts.description: A compactification of a variety that admits singularities, unavoidable in certain log CY completions of higher-degree coverings.

concepts.label: anticanonical system
concepts.description: The linear system of divisors in the anticanonical class of a Fano variety; its dimension bounds the number of singular fibers.

concepts.label: fiber over infinity
concepts.description: The special fiber at infinity in a compactification, whose number of components is conjectured to equal the anticanonical dimension.

concepts.label: projective space covering
concepts.description: A finite morphism from an algebraic variety to projective space, of controlled degree and Gorenstein index; studied for degrees >2.

concepts.label: smoothness obstruction
concepts.description: Topological or algebraic constraints that prevent a log CY compactification from admitting a smooth projective model.

concepts.label: degree-indexed family
concepts.description: A parametrized family of coverings of ℙ^n classified by degree d; degree >2 coverings exhibit unavoidable singularities in log CY compactifications.

concepts.label: Gorenstein index
concepts.description: A numerical invariant measuring the singularity type of a variety; used to classify coverings of projective space.

concepts.label: Tyurin degeneration
concepts.description: A special type of degeneration of Calabi-Yau manifolds characterized by singular fibers that preserve structure relevant to mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Doran-Harder-Thompson conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture bridging mirror symmetry for Calabi-Yau manifolds to mirror symmetry for quasi-Fano varieties via Tyurin degenerations.

concepts.label: Theta function
concepts.description: Special function arising in geometric quantization and SYZ mirror symmetry; used to reconstruct the mirror variety from torus fibration data.

concepts.label: Geometric quantization
concepts.description: Method assigning quantum operators to classical Poisson structures; used in constructing mirror maps and Landau-Ginzburg models.

concepts.label: Quasi-Fano manifold
concepts.description: Variety with ample anticanonical bundle −K_X; natural mirror partner to certain Landau-Ginzburg models and degenerations.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau fibration
concepts.description: A fibration where the fibers are Calabi-Yau manifolds; splitting such fibrations yields new Landau-Ginzburg constructions.

concepts.label: mirror manifold
concepts.description: Dual Calabi-Yau manifold related by mirror symmetry, with complex-structure moduli exchanged for Kähler moduli of the original.

concepts.label: global properties of solutions
concepts.description: Boundary conditions and monodromy constraints on period integrals near singular loci (large-structure, conifold) ensuring consistency and uniqueness.

concepts.label: plane cubic curves
concepts.description: One-dimensional complex algebraic curves defined by homogeneous cubic polynomials in projective 2-space; genus-one curves with special arithmetic and modular properties.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau varieties
concepts.description: Complex Kähler manifolds with vanishing first Chern class; central to string theory compactifications and mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Weil-Petersson geometry
concepts.description: Riemannian geometry on the moduli space of Calabi-Yau varieties induced by the Hodge metric on period domain; measures deformations of complex structure.

concepts.label: arithmetic properties
concepts.description: Number-theoretic invariants and phenomena on algebraic varieties, such as rational points, zeta functions, and Galois representations.

concepts.label: holomorphic differential forms
concepts.description: Closed (p,q)-forms with holomorphic coefficients; for CY3, the (3,0)-form Ω integrates to give periods.

concepts.label: D-term uplifting
concepts.description: Lifting of AdS vacua to dS via D-term potential from magnetized D7-branes maintaining supersymmetry breaking at the moduli-stabilization locus.

edges.evidence: Survey focuses on SYZ mirror symmetry for compact toric and toric Calabi-Yau varieties, establishing geometric fibration framework.
SYZ mirror symmetry is defined via special Lagrangian fibrations; the geometric dual is obtained through the SL structure.
Period integrals Π_a(z) satisfy the Picard-Fuchs differential system L_i Π = 0 derived from the toric ambient space.
Period integrals Π_a(z) depend on complex-structure moduli z = (z_1,...,z_{h^{2,1}}).
Flux superpotential W = ∫(G_3 ∧ Ω) = G_a Π^a + F_a is directly expressed as periods multiplied by flux quantum numbers.
Flux superpotential W provides the potential energy for stabilizing moduli via extremization ∂W/∂z_i = 0.
KKLT is a specific moduli stabilization scenario using flux to fix complex structure with W_0 << 1, then non-perturbative uplift.
LVS is an alternative moduli stabilization regime with exponentially large volumes V ~ e^{aτ_s} and different hierarchies.
Kähler potential K = -ln(-i∫(Ω∧Ω̄)) - 2ln(V) encodes the dynamics of Kähler moduli τ^a.
Mirror map t^a = ∂F/∂X^a connects Kähler moduli of one CY to complex-structure moduli of the mirror via periods.
Periods (via prepotential F) directly determine the mirror map that exchanges Kähler and complex-structure coordinates.
Open question whether complex-structure stabilization causally constrains the Kähler moduli subspace; mirror map suggests coupling.
Yukawa couplings κ_{abc} = F_{abc} appear as cubic terms in the superpotential and encode four-point interactions.
D6 symmetry reduces h^{2,1}=20 to 5 invariant moduli, making the GKZ Picard-Fuchs system tractable for explicit computation.
Toric CY geometry (polytope, fan) determines the periods through the structure of the holomorphic (3,0)-form.
Period integrals Π_a(z) are solutions to the GKZ differential system L_i Π = 0, with the system structure determined by toric data.
The GKZ system is constructed from the GLSM charge matrix of the toric ambient space; Gröbner basis of toric ideal yields finite set of differential operators.
Period integrals Π_a(z) = ∫_{γ_a} Ω(z) are defined by integrating the holomorphic (3,0)-form Ω over cycles in the CY3.
Mirror symmetry relates period integrals on the CY to quantum geometry of the mirror; complex-structure moduli map to Kähler moduli via mirror map.
The Gröbner basis for the toric ideal determines a finite set of differential operators for local solutions of the GKZ system.
At the large radius limit, the principal parts of GKZ operators show close relationship with the intersection ring of the toric variety.
Principal parts of GKZ operators encode intersection theory; differential structure encodes Yukawa couplings determined by intersection numbers.
The complex-structure moduli dimension equals h^{2,1}, the Hodge number of (2,1)-forms.
Calabi-Yau hypersurfaces are classified and analyzed by their Hodge numbers, with applications to Fermat and non-Fermat types up to stated values.
Fermat hypersurfaces are a special class of toric CY hypersurfaces analyzed explicitly for period integral computation.
Local solutions to the GKZ system provide explicit analytic expressions for periods near special points like large radius limit.
The structure of the toric ideal, via its Gröbner basis, determines the differential operators comprising the GKZ system.
Non-Landau-Ginzburg models are identified and analyzed as singular limits related to the CY3 geometry.
Toric geometry provides systematic framework for mirror symmetry; toric fans encode both direct and mirror polytopes; GKZ systems relate period integrals to mirror geometry.
The Schoen CY3 has h²¹=12 complex-structure moduli; the paper studies 5 D₆-invariant combinations.
The Schoen CY3 has h¹¹=12 Kähler moduli; LVS requires at least one small cycle.
Period integrals Π_a(z) are functions of complex-structure parameters z; they satisfy Picard-Fuchs equations.
Mirror map t^a = ∂F/∂X^a; periods on the CY3 determine Kähler coordinates on the mirror.
Mirror map relates periods (complex-structure on CY3) to Kähler moduli on the mirror.
The effective potential is derived from W and Kähler potential K via V_eff supergravity formula.
LVS and KKLT require W_np ~ e^{-aτ} from instantons/gaugino condensation to stabilize volume.
Intersection numbers κ_{abc} determine the F-function and volume scaling V ~ e^{aτ_s} in LVS; paper computes them explicitly.
LVS stabilizes Kähler moduli via flux superpotential and non-perturbative terms; volume remains large V >> 1.
Moduli are fixed at extrema of V_eff; stabilization analysis studies critical points of the potential.
Paper finds special F-term uplift contributions from self-mirror LVS that generate de Sitter vacua.
Swampland conjecture |∇V| ≥ c·V rules out metastable dS vacua; paper discusses compatibility of LVS dS with swampland constraints.
Paper explicitly realizes LVS on Schoen CY3 with h¹¹=12, h²¹=12; shows self-mirror geometry enables dS vacua.
Paper discusses whether LVS dS vacua satisfy Swampland de Sitter conjecture constraints.
Period integrals (CS-dependent) enter the superpotential, which generates the effective potential; CS stabilization affects Kähler moduli via mirror map.
Calabi-Yau m-folds are defined by admitting a unique nowhere-vanishing holomorphic (m,0)-form Ω (Abstract, Intro).
Calabi-Yau m-folds are introduced via holonomy groups, with holonomy ⊆ SU(m) (Abstract).
Calabi-Yau manifolds admit a unique Ricci-flat Kähler metric in each Kähler class via the Calabi Conjecture.
The Calabi Conjecture (Yau, 1978) proves existence and uniqueness of Ricci-flat Kähler metrics on Calabi-Yau manifolds.
Calabi-Yau manifolds are introduced via Kähler geometry and the Calabi Conjecture (Abstract).
Special Lagrangian m-folds are introduced via calibrated geometry with a calibrating form (Abstract).
Special Lagrangian submanifolds are studied as cycles within (almost) Calabi-Yau m-folds (Abstract).
The deformation theory and moduli spaces of compact special Lagrangian submanifolds in Calabi-Yau m-folds are described, controlling global variation (Abstract).
Isolated singularities of special Lagrangian m-folds are analyzed, locally modelled on cones (Abstract).
Mirror Symmetry connects periods (integrals of Ω) and Gromov-Witten invariants between mirror pairs (Abstract).
The SYZ Conjecture proposes that mirror Calabi-Yau pairs admit dual special Lagrangian fibrations, explaining mirror symmetry geometrically (Abstract).
The SYZ Conjecture provides a geometric explanation for mirror symmetry via special Lagrangian fibrations (Abstract).
Almost Calabi-Yau m-folds are a generalization useful in special Lagrangian geometry and deformation theory (Abstract).
Special Lagrangian m-folds are submanifolds within Calabi-Yau m-folds defined by a phase condition on Ω (Abstract, deformation theory).
Complex-structure moduli z = (z_1,...,z_{h^{2,1}}) parameterize deformations of the CY manifold preserving holomorphicity.
Kähler moduli t^a describe the Kähler cone and divisor volumes within the CY threefold.
Differential equations L_i Π = 0 uniquely determine the period integrals given initial conditions and the GKZ system structure.
Via the mirror map t^a = ∂F/∂X^a, periods on the mirror determine Kähler coordinates on the original CY.
At the conifold singularity, BPS states become massless, fundamentally altering the low-energy spectrum and effective dynamics.
Enhanced gauge symmetries are geometrically engineered near singular loci including the conifold, where massless charged states arise.
Gauge theories with charged matter generate hypermultiplet moduli spaces; the text describes SU(N) gauge theories coupled to adjoint hypermultiplets.
The stringy thermal potential lifts all complex-structure moduli involved in engineered gauge theories; 'all Kahler and complex structure moduli involved in the gauge theories are lifted'.
The thermal potential provides explicit stabilization of Kähler moduli; shown for type IIA with h^{11}=2 where both Kähler moduli are stabilized.
The analysis demonstrates that the entire vector multiplet moduli space can be lifted by the thermal potential at singular loci intersections.
Hypermultiplet moduli are dynamically stabilized together with vector multiplets during cosmological evolution under thermal potential back-reaction.
Analysis proceeds without integrating out BPS states becoming massless at singular loci, indicating their importance for the thermal dynamics.
Type IIA on CY3 is dual to heterotic string on K3 × T²; the text demonstrates both Kähler moduli and axio-dilaton stabilization in the dual picture.
In the dual thermal heterotic picture on K3 × T², the axio-dilaton is stabilized alongside the torus modulus via the mirror duality map.
The text shows that favorable stabilization points sit at intersections of singular loci including the conifold, indicating geometric necessity.
Self-mirror CY construction trivializes α'-corrections due to the self-duality property, simplifying the effective potential.
GKZ differential operators L_i satisfy L_i Π = 0, governing the analytic structure of periods.
Non-perturbative W_np terms provide the dominant uplift contribution in LVS, scaling as e^{-aτ_s}.
LVS stabilizes Kähler moduli via competition between non-perturbative and perturbative contributions with exponentially large volume V ~ e^{aτ_s}.
Self-mirror CY construction enables LVS with T-dual non-geometric fluxes while trivializing α'-corrections.
Non-perturbative contributions and F-term uplift both contribute to the effective potential at comparable order in large-volume limit.
de Sitter conjecture |∇V| ≥ c·V restricts the allowed parameter space for metastable dS vacua; self-mirror LVS with non-perturbative uplift satisfies these bounds.
Non-perturbative uplift in large volume scenario naturally generates de Sitter vacua consistent with swampland conjectures.
T-duality symmetry motivates embeddings in self-mirror CY constructions to naturally incorporate non-geometric fluxes.
Mirror map relates complex-structure moduli on one CY to Kähler moduli on the mirror, encoded via t^a = ∂F/∂X^a.
Type IIB orientifold compactification is the framework within which Kähler moduli stabilization is performed.
CY3 serves as the internal geometry in type IIB orientifold compactification on CY3 × ℝ^{3,1}.
The considered Calabi-Yau threefolds are K3-fibred and admit at least one del Pezzo surface.
K3-fibred volume form enables systematic decomposition into base and fibre contributions for Kähler moduli parameterization.
Non-perturbative superpotential including gaugino condensation and poly-instanton corrections is used to fix all four Kähler moduli.
Gaugino condensation corrections are explicitly included in the non-perturbative superpotential construction.
Poly-instanton corrections contribute additional terms to the non-perturbative superpotential.
The total superpotential W combines flux contribution W_0 and non-perturbative W_np.
α′-corrections to Kähler potential are used alongside the superpotential to fix all four Kähler moduli.
Kähler potential with α′-corrections is essential for achieving consistent moduli stabilization.
K3-fibred CY3 geometries admit at least one del Pezzo surface as a divisor.
K3-fibred CY3 geometries admit at least one W-surface as a divisor.
Reflexive lattice polytopes classify four-dimensional CY3 geometries; authors searched all reflexive polytopes to identify 23 satisfying the requirements.
The K3-fibred volume form provides the parameterization of Kähler moduli space.
The Picard-Fuchs system is generated by GKZ differential operators L_i determined by the lattice of the toric ambient space.
Period integrals on CY manifolds are a special case of Abelian integrals of algebraic differential forms over cycles.
Proved isomorphism between the module of relative cohomologies H^*(X,X_∞) and the module of Abelian integrals.
Periods are integrals Π_a(z) of the holomorphic form, explicitly depending on complex-structure moduli z as arguments.
Period integrals are defined as Π_a(z) = ∫_{γ_a} Ω(z), where Ω is the holomorphic (3,0)-form.
Period integrals are explicitly integrals over cycles γ_a in the relative homology of the variety.
Abelian integrals are defined as integrals of algebraic differential forms over cycles.
The module of Abelian integrals corresponds to a regular at infinity polynomial in two variables.
Relative cohomology H^*(X,X_∞) is a fundamental invariant of the pair (variety, behavior at infinity).
Using the isomorphism between relative cohomologies and Abelian integrals, existence and properties of the Picard-Fuchs system are deduced.
Period integrals Π_a(z) depend on complex-structure parameters z_i ∈ ℂ^{h^{2,1}}.
Authors stabilize complex structure and dilaton with fluxes via the flux superpotential W.
The resultant potential combining flux superpotential and racetrack term exhibits dS critical points (saddle points).
Racetrack potentials lead to potentials that generically exhibit de Sitter critical points.
Paper demonstrates dS saddle points that violate the strong form of the dS Swampland Conjecture |∇V|/V ≥ c.
Stabilization with fluxes must satisfy flux quantization consistency requirement.
Models must satisfy large internal volume consistency requirement for validity.
Stabilization must maintain weak coupling g_s << 1 for perturbative validity.
dS saddle points are checked against Weak Gravity Conjecture consistency.
Type IIB/CY3 compactifications are fundamentally characterized by periods of the holomorphic (3,0)-form.
Racetrack potential mechanism provides non-perturbative Kähler moduli stabilization.
Mirror symmetry relates complex-structure periods on one family to Kähler data on the mirror; periods of the mirror determine the prepotential.
GKZ operators L_i encode the z-dependence of periods; the system structure is determined by the moduli space dimension h^{2,1}.
IVHS are families of (3,0)-forms Ω(z) whose integrals over cycles γ_a form period vectors satisfying Picard-Fuchs equations.
One-parameter families of CY with h^{2,1}=1 and b³=4 provide geometric realizations of integral variations of Hodge structure.
Mirror map t^a = ∂F/∂X^a relates complex-structure periods on the original CY to Kähler moduli on the mirror.
Yukawa couplings F_{abc} = κ_{abc} (intersection numbers) and κ_{αβγ}(z) are encoded in the prepotential computed from periods via special geometry.
Special Kähler structure on moduli space relates Kähler metric K_{ij̄} and Yukawa functions κ_{αβγ} to period integrals and their derivatives.
Via mirror map, complex-structure periods determine Kähler metric and moduli space geometry on the mirror side.
One-parameter CY families with h^{2,1}=1 and b³=4 serve as geometric realizations of IVHS; classification parallels geometric classification.
One-parameter families of CY are realized as fibrations over ℙ¹ \ {0,1,∞}, with singularities (large-complex-structure, conifold, etc.) at punctures.
Classification of IVHS underlying CY families directly addresses which abstract VHS have geometric realizations as CY periods.
CY compactifications possess h^{2,1} complex-structure moduli parametrising deformations of the complex structure.
CY compactifications possess h^{1,1} Kähler moduli parametrising the Kähler form.
The paper states complex-structure moduli must be stabilised in phenomenologically-relevant vacua, motivating the study of flux-based stabilisation.
Flux superpotential W = G_a Π^a + F_a is explicitly defined as periods Π^a contracted with flux quantum numbers G_a.
Periods Π_a(z) depend on complex-structure coordinates z_i as Π_a(z) = ∫_{γ_a} Ω(z).
The conjecture proposes that the number of stabilised complex-structure moduli grows at most linearly with flux tadpole charge N_flux.
The tadpole bound N_flux ≤ 2/3 h_{2,1} is the quantitative form of the tadpole conjecture.
The paper describes the Gepner model as a non-geometric background mirror dual to a rigid Calabi-Yau.
The Gepner model is the mirror dual to a rigid Calabi-Yau manifold, exemplifying mirror symmetry in the non-geometric regime.
The Gepner model, a non-geometric background, is mirror dual to a rigid Calabi-Yau with h^{2,1}=0.
A rigid CY has h^{2,1}=0, possessing no complex-structure deformations and hence no complex moduli.
Minkowski vacua with dW/dz_i=0 require fixed moduli; the paper constructs such solutions with all complex moduli massive.
The paper constructs supersymmetric Minkowski flux solutions and tests whether they satisfy the tadpole bound, confirming linear growth.
The paper scrutinises the tadpole conjecture using the Gepner model, constructing an extensive set of supersymmetric Minkowski solutions to confirm linear growth.
The paper shows that non-geometric Gepner backgrounds yield Minkowski vacua with all moduli massive, refuting the massless Minkowski conjecture beyond supergravity.
Calabi-Yau operators 'make their appearance as Picard-Fuchs operators of families of Calabi-Yau threefolds' (Abstract).
Picard-Fuchs operators determine the differential equations L_i Π = 0 satisfied by periods Π_a(z).
Periods Π_a(z) are functions of complex-structure moduli z = (z_1,...,z_{h^{2,1}}).
Picard-Fuchs operators are Fuchsian differential operators with regular singularities determining VHS.
CY operators 'conjecturally determine ℚ-local systems that underly a variation of Hodge structure' (Abstract).
ℚ-local systems provide the monodromy structure underlying variations of Hodge structure.
VHS with fixed Hodge numbers h^{3,0}=h^{2,1}=h^{1,2}=h^{0,3}=1 characterize CY operators.
Picard-Fuchs operators appearing as CY operators encode the variation of the unique (3,0)-form on CY3.
Mirror symmetry implies periods on one side determine Kähler coordinates on the mirror via t^a = ∂F/∂X^a.
Picard-Fuchs periods 'encode the numbers of rational curves on a mirror manifold' (Abstract).
CY operators are 'motivated by mirror symmetry of one-parameter models' (Abstract).
Picard-Fuchs systems and periods determine special-geometry data: F_{abc} from intersection numbers and Kähler metrics from period derivatives.
Complex-structure moduli stabilization via flux superpotential W = G_a Π^a uses periods determined by Picard-Fuchs operators.
Periods Π_a(z) are holomorphic functions of complex-structure moduli z_i that parameterize the period domain.
Mirror symmetry provides computational access to period integrals and Yukawa couplings via dual manifold analysis.
Variations of Hodge structure governing period geometry are constrained by Griffiths transversality, an integrability condition.
Special geometry determines the Kähler metric and Yukawa couplings from the prepotential, which governs the superpotential structure.
KKLT requires W_0 from flux stabilization followed by non-perturbative W_np; W_0 must satisfy |W_0| << 1.
KKLT stabilizes Kähler moduli via gaugino condensation and D3-instantons contributing non-perturbative superpotential.
LVS achieves exponentially large volume V ~ e^{aτ_s} with Swiss-cheese small cycles and requires h^{1,1} >= 2.
Swampland conjecture |∇V| >= c·V may exclude metastable dS vacua from KKLT; compatibility remains debated.
Uncertainty whether LVS vacua satisfy the swampland de Sitter bound; compatibility is an open question.
Stabilization fixes moduli on the moduli space of the CY3; the fixed point loci are projective special Kähler.
Frobenius algebra structure on cohomology permits decomposition of period matrix into semisimple and nilpotent parts.
Feynman integrals can be solved by iterated integrals of periods; regulated IBP relations factorize using period decomposition.
W = ∫(G_3 ∧ Ω) = G_a Π^a where G_3 includes H-flux and F-flux components.
Q-flux and R-flux contribute to the three-form G_3 appearing in W = ∫(G_3 ∧ Ω).
Superpotential W is a linear combination of periods: W = G_a Π^a; periods determine Yukawa texture via second derivatives of W.
Kähler potential K = -ln(-i∫(Ω∧Ω̄)) - 2ln(V) determines the scalar potential V = e^K(|D_i W|² - 3|W|²).
Mirror map relates complex-structure moduli on CY to Kähler coordinates on mirror; question raised whether cs stabilization constrains Kähler subspace.
Flux tadpole N_flux must satisfy tadpole conjecture: flux tadpole contribution ≤ 2/3 h_{2,1}, limiting available fluxes.
Paper derives that non-geometric flux contributions to tadpole cancellation should be similar to D-branes, not anti-D-branes.
Examples of stable de Sitter constructions found with (non-)geometric fluxes via classical flux stabilization.
Swampland bound |∇V| ≥ c·V excludes metastable dS vacua; paper finds de Sitter constructions that violate this conjecture.
Paper reassesses known de Sitter constructions with (non-)geometric fluxes and argues these are not consistent in string theory.
Type IIB orientifold compactifications studied on Calabi-Yau three-folds with (non-)geometric fluxes.
GKZ differential system L_i Π = 0 encodes constraints on period integrals and thus on moduli space geometry.
Stabilized moduli with hierarchical masses are essential for validity of the low-energy EFT approximation.
LVS can generate metastable dS vacua via D-term or F-term uplifts, though compatibility with swampland is debated.
Anti-D3 branes in the throat lift AdS to dS by breaking supersymmetry with non-perturbative contributions.
Metastable dS vacua decay via BT instanton processes changing flux quantum numbers.
Semiclassical CDL tunneling competes with BT decay; CDL to decompactification is exponentially dominant.
CDL mechanism yields decay rate Γ ~ exp(-S_E) where S_E is the Euclidean action, expressed in terms of volumes.
BT decay rates computed from flux-changing instanton action, also exponential in volume.
All decay rates scale as exponentials of the volume; larger V suppresses transitions.
Swampland de Sitter conjecture |∇V| ≥ c·V excludes some metastable dS constructions, but compatibility with LVS is debated.
LVS produces dS vacua that may violate swampland bounds; tension unresolved.
Mirror symmetry relates Kähler moduli on one CY to complex-structure moduli on the mirror; stabilization may causally couple them.
LVS is a specific regime of type IIB CY3 compactifications with hierarchical moduli masses.
EFT analysis of BT instanton decay requires that instanton size remains parametrically small relative to CY scale.
CDL tunneling analysis valid only if barrier height and widths lie within the EFT regime.
Period integrals Π_a(z) = ∫_{γ_a} Ω encode the geometric properties of the CY3 via the holomorphic (3,0)-form.
Complex structure is encoded in the prepotential F(X^a) via the mirror map; periods at stabilization locus predict exact Yukawa texture.
Yukawa couplings F_{abc} = ∂³F/∂X^a∂X^b∂X^c are derived as third derivatives of the prepotential.
Mirror symmetry swaps complex-structure moduli on one CY3 with Kähler moduli on its mirror; h^{1,1} ↔ h^{2,1}.
The prepotential on the mirror is determined by Gromov-Witten invariants via mirror symmetry predictions.
At boundary points with maximal unipotent local monodromy, the period matrix exhibits a canonical structure analogous to the crystalline cohomology.
Canonical coordinates on moduli space, often periods or their derivatives, exhibit integral properties observed in mirror symmetry examples.
Crystalline cohomology is used to study the arithmetic and p-adic geometry of ordinary varieties in characteristic p.
An ordinary Calabi-Yau threefold in characteristic p is a CY3 where the Frobenius acts with maximal rank on crystalline cohomology.
The paper shows p-adic analogues of integrality properties for canonical coordinates and the prepotential observed in complex mirror symmetry.
Special geometry relates the Kähler metric and prepotential to Yukawa couplings F_{abc} via κ_{abc} = F_{abc} at large volume.
The boundary of the complex-structure moduli space is characterized by maximal unipotent local monodromy singularities.
Crystalline cohomology of ordinary CY3 in characteristic p exhibits structure analogous to the prepotential and Yukawa couplings in complex geometry.
B-brane superpotentials depending on several closed- and open-moduli are calculated via period integrals through mirror symmetry.
Period integrals are parametrized by complex-structure moduli z = (z_1,...,z_{h^{2,1}}) and satisfy differential equations.
By blowing up the ambient space along a curve wrapped by B-branes, we obtain a blow-up new manifold and the period integral satisfying the GKZ-system (Abstract).
Via mirror symmetry to A-model, we calculate the superpotentials (Abstract).
Ooguri-Vafa invariants are extracted via the A-model calculation of open-string amplitudes.
Blowing up the ambient space along a curve produces a manifold whose period integrals satisfy the GKZ-system determined by the toric lattice.
B-brane superpotentials depend on several closed- and open-moduli (Abstract).
B-brane superpotentials depend on several closed- and open-moduli (Abstract).
Period integrals Π_a(z) = ∫_{γ_a} Ω(z) where Ω(z) is the holomorphic (3,0)-form parametrized by complex-structure moduli.
Calabi-Yau hypersurfaces are characterized by admitting a holomorphic (3,0)-form.
We study superpotentials on Calabi-Yau complete intersections and extract their periods (Abstract).
Ooguri-Vafa invariants are extracted from concrete examples and constrain the superpotential (Abstract).
The matter metric K_{I J̄} is defined as the second derivative of the Kähler potential, K_{I J̄} = ∂_I ∂_{J̄} K, controlling kinetic terms in the effective Lagrangian.
The paper computes modular weights of D7-brane bifundamental matter using techniques that extract the Kähler moduli dependence of the Kähler potential for matter fields.
Matter metrics depend on Kähler moduli through the Kähler potential; modular weights encode this scaling dependence in a perturbative expansion.
Modular weights are scaling exponents under Kähler moduli rescaling that determine the Kähler potential dependence; the paper extracts these weights using scaling arguments and locality.
Knowledge of Yukawa coupling structure is sufficient to constrain the Kähler potential; the paper uses Yukawa structure to guide extraction of modular dependence.
The large-volume scenario V >> 1 permits controlled perturbative expansions in αʹ and gs; the paper uses scaling arguments valid in this regime.
Kähler moduli t^a parameterize the Kähler cone of the CY3 and determine divisor volumes; essential data for CY compactifications.
In gravity-mediated SUSY breaking, soft term coefficients (gaugino masses, A-terms) are determined by derivatives of the Kähler potential and superpotential.
Knowledge of the complete Kähler potential is needed to compute the scalar potential and find stabilization points; the paper contributes to this understanding.
The paper applies techniques to toroidal compactifications and compares results with exact Kähler potentials known for these cases, using them to benchmark methods.
Yukawa couplings arise from the overlap of matter wavefunctions on D7 branes; their moduli dependence is governed by the matter Kähler potential.
The paper develops a perturbative expansion in Kähler moduli to extract modular weights; each order corresponds to a definite scaling under moduli rescaling.
The slow-roll requirement on the scalar potential translates to a geometric constraint on the Kähler geometry of the vacuum (Abstract, Introduction).
The inflationary constraint leads to a hard bound on the moduli space geometry (Abstract).
Slow-roll requirement on the scalar potential is the foundation for Kähler moduli inflation constraints.
Type IIB string compactifications on O3/O7 orientifold generate the ensemble of CY landscape geometries (Abstract).
The flux superpotential W(z) stabilises the complex-structure moduli at tree level via minimisation ∂W/∂z_i = 0.
Type IIB compactifications are defined by their orientifold projection; O3/O7-planes are the defining structure here.
The inflationary constraint is independent of the moduli space dimension (Abstract), yet geometries are parameterised by h^{1,1} + h^{2,1}.
Only 6.57% of geometries inspected support high-scale Kähler moduli inflation, showing strong filtering by inflationary constraint (Abstract).
The volume modulus or fibre moduli serve as the inflaton field in Kähler moduli inflation scenarios.
Slow-roll conditions (ε ≪ 1, η ≪ 1) are computed as derivatives of the scalar potential.
The Kähler potential K determines the metric structure and field-space geometry entering the potential V = e^K(...).
The procedure constructs log CY compactifications of weak LG models (Abstract); LG models are the non-compact base objects being completed.
Mirror symmetry relates Fano varieties to LG models; the paper applies the LG/Fano duality framework to del Pezzo surfaces and coverings.
Del Pezzo surfaces are defined as Fano surfaces; the paper explicitly studies del Pezzo surfaces as primary examples of Fano varieties.
For coverings of degree greater than 2, the log CY compactification is singular; moreover, no smooth projective log CY compactification exists.
Coverings of degree >2 necessarily yield singular log CY compactifications; smoothness fails above degree 2.
The conjecture proves that the number of components of the fiber over infinity equals the dimension of the anticanonical system of the Fano variety.
Anticanonical system dimension is a fundamental invariant of Fano varieties; the paper uses anticanonical dimension to classify geometric behavior.
No smooth projective log CY compactification exists for certain coverings; obstructions force singularities to be unavoidable.
The paper classifies coverings of projective space by degree and Gorenstein index as the relevant structural parameters.
Log CY compactifications provide explicit geometric realizations of mirror symmetry between Fano varieties and LG models via the compactification procedure.
Mirror symmetry fundamentally pairs Calabi-Yau manifolds, exchanging their complex and Kähler geometry.
Tyurin degenerations are special limiting cases of Calabi-Yau families discussed throughout.
DHT conjecture builds a bridge using Tyurin degenerations as the central tool.
Conjecture extends mirror symmetry from Calabi-Yau manifolds to quasi-Fano varieties.
SYZ construction is fundamentally based on special Lagrangian torus fibrations; pairs dual fibrations.
Paper emphasizes SYZ fibrations of Calabi-Yau manifolds as geometric basis for mirror symmetry.
Periods are functions of moduli; PF system depends on the structure of the moduli space.
Paper cites theta functions as related topics arising from SYZ mirror symmetry analysis.
Geometric quantization is mentioned alongside SYZ as a related topic for constructing mirrors.
DHT conjecture connects LG models (from CY fibrations) to quasi-Fano mirrors.
Paper proposes new LG construction by splitting Calabi-Yau fibrations; splitting CY fibrations yields LG models.
Complex-structure deformations z_i parametrize inequivalent CY geometries; the number of moduli equals h^{2,1}.
Period integrals Π_a(z) are functions of the complex-structure moduli z, encoding moduli-dependent geometric information.
Mirror symmetry exchanges complex-structure moduli of the original with Kähler moduli of the mirror manifold.
The mirror map relating periods on mirror to Kähler moduli effects the complex-structure–Kähler back-reaction encoded in K.
Boundary conditions and monodromy at singular loci (large-structure, conifold) must supplement the Picard-Fuchs equation to ensure consistency.
Kähler potential K depends on Kähler moduli τ^a and volume V; K = -ln(-i∫(Ω∧Ω̄)) - 2ln(V).
Complex-structure moduli are fixed by the flux superpotential; ∂W/∂z_i = 0 determines stabilization locus.
Mirror duality exchanges Kähler moduli of one CY with complex-structure moduli of its mirror partner.
Period integrals on the mirror determine genus-zero Gromov-Witten invariants of the original CY via mirror symmetry (Abstract).
Periods encode the Hodge structure; their variation with moduli defines the variation of Hodge structure (Abstract, domain context).
Application of Picard-Fuchs equations in studying genus zero Gromov-Witten invariants of Calabi-Yau varieties (Abstract).
Weil-Petersson geometry is defined on the moduli space controlled by complex-structure parameters and relates to period integrals (Abstract).
Plane cubic curves are a primary example for discussing arithmetic aspects of mirror symmetry (Title, Abstract).
Period integrals are integrals of holomorphic differential forms over cycles; the (3,0)-form Ω on CY3 integrates to give periods.
The Picard-Fuchs equation can be used to reveal arithmetic properties of plane cubics and mirror pairs (Abstract).
Calabi-Yau varieties are the central objects on which mirror symmetry acts; application to genus-zero GW invariants stated (Abstract).
Mirror symmetry relates enumerative invariants to periods, which structure the Weil-Petersson metric on moduli spaces (Abstract).
Π_a(z) = ∫_{γ_a} Ω(z) explicitly depends on z = (z_1,...,z_{h^{2,1}}); periods encode moduli structure.
W = ∫(G_3 ∧ Ω) = G_a Π^a; flux couples linearly to periods (Gukov-Vafa formula).
W determines scalar dynamics and enters effective equations for volume stabilization via ∂W/∂τ^a terms.
Closed string fluxes fix dilaton and complex structure moduli; superpotential W encodes stabilization constraint via periods.
Non-perturbative W_np from gaugino condensation/D3-instantons stabilizes volume when |W_0| << 1.
KKLT uplifts AdS to dS via anti-D3 branes; central dS construction in string theory but contested.
LVS achieves V ~ e^{a τ_s} >> 1 with hierarchical W_0 ~ O(1) from small Swiss cheese cycles.
Magnetized D7-branes provide D-term potential lifting AdS moduli-stabilization vacua consistently to dS_4.
K = -2ln(V) term directly controls volume dynamics; perturbative quantum corrections to K stabilize V in AdS.
dS conjecture |∇V| ≥ c·V excludes metastable dS vacua; compatibility with KKLT/LVS debated.
Flux tadpole bound N_flux ≤ 2/3 h_{2,1} rules out many KKLT constructions; computational testing needed.
Mirror map t^a = ∂F/∂X^a connects complex-structure periods to Kähler coordinates on mirror; back-reaction channel.
Period integrals are primary objects in special geometry encoding Yukawa couplings F_{abc} and Kähler metric K_{ij̄}.
KKLT anti-D3 uplift mechanism for dS; subject to Maldacena-Nunez and Danielsson-Van Riet criticism regarding backreaction.
